alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 25 at 1:30AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following county, Okanogan. * WHEN...From 11 AM PDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving thunderstorms are expected over the East Slopes of the North Cascades this afternoon and evening. Any resulting localized heavy rainfall may impact locations in and near burn scars in steep terrain which will be susceptable to flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
